info.name: Official Akeneo PIM REST API Serenity
info.description:
The Akeneo REST API brought to you!

Find out how this Postman collection works by visiting https://api.akeneo.com

request.description: Assuming that the given uuid is the unique identifier of an existing catalog
Assuming that the given uuid is the unique identifier of an existing catalog
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing association type
Assuming that there is no "new_association_type" already existing

query.description: (boolean ) • Return the options of 'select' column types (of a table attribute) in the response. (Only available on SaaS platforms)

request.description: Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing attribute

query.description: Get the attributes that have been updated since July 4th, 2020 at 10 am (UTC), you can use the following URL.
Get the attributes that code is in the given list
Get the attributes of types pim_catalog_simpleselect and pim_catalog_multiselect, you can use the following URL.
(integer , 1 by default ) • Number of the page to retrieve when using the `page` pagination method type.
(integer , 10 by default )  • Number of results by page.
(boolean ) • Return the count of items in the response. Be carefull with that, on a big catalog, it can decrease performance in a significative way.
(boolean ) • Return the options of 'select' column types (of a table attribute) in the response. (Only available on SaaS platforms)

body.raw:
{
  "code": "new_attribute",
  "type": "pim_catalog_boolean",
  "group": "technical",
  "unique": false,
  "useable_as_grid_filter": true,
  "allowed_extensions": [],
  "metric_family": null,
  "default_metric_unit": null,
  "reference_data_name": null,
  "available_locales": [],
  "max_characters": null,
  "validation_rule": null,
  "validation_regexp": null,
  "wysiwyg_enabled": null,
  "number_min": null,
  "number_max": null,
  "decimals_allowed": null,
  "negative_allowed": null,
  "date_min": null,
  "date_max": null,
  "max_file_size": null,
  "minimum_input_length": null,
  "sort_order": 39,
  "localizable": false,
  "scopable": false,
  "labels": {
    "de_DE": "new attribute label DE",
    "en_US": "new attribute label US",
    "fr_FR": "new attribute label FR"
  }
}

request.description: Assuming that there is no "new_attribute" already existing

request.description: Assuming that the given codes are respectively the code of an existing attribute and an existing option of this attribute
Assuming that there is no "yellow" option already existing for the given attribute
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing attribute
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing attribute
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing attribute group

query.description: Only returns attribute groups that are in the list.
Only returns attribute groups that were updated after the given day and hour.
(integer , 1 by default ) • Number of the page to retrieve when using the `page` pagination method type. Should never be set manually.
(integer , 10 by default )  • Number of results by page.
(boolean ) • Return the count of items in the response. Be carefull with that, on a big catalog, it can decrease performance in a significative way.

request.description: Assuming that there is no "new_attribute_group" already existing

query.description: Return information about category position into its category tree (only available on SaaS platforms)

request.description: Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing category

query.description: Get only root categories
Get the child categories of the parent category categoryA, you can use the following URL.
Get only categories that are in the list
Get the categories that have been updated since May 17th, 2021 at 10 am (UTC), you can use the following URL.
(integer , 1 by default ) • Number of the page to retrieve when using the `page` pagination method type.
(integer , 10 by default )  • Number of results by page.
(boolean ) • Return the count of items in the response. Be carefull with that, on a big catalog, it can decrease performance in a significative way.
(boolean ) • Return information about category position into its category tree (only available on SaaS platforms)

request.description: Assuming that there is no "new_category" already existing
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing channel
Assuming that there is no "new_channel" already existing
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing currency
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing family

query.description: Only returns families that are in the list.
Only returns families that were updated after the given day and hour.
When true, only returns families with at least one product (true) or families with no products (false).
(integer , 1 by default ) • Number of the page to retrieve when using the `page` pagination method type. Should never be set manually.
(integer , 10 by default )  • Number of results by page.
(boolean ) • Return the count of items in the response. Be carefull with that, on a big catalog, it can decrease performance in a significative way.

body.raw:
{
  "code": "new_family",
  "attributes": [
    "container_material",
    "description",
    "main_color",
    "name",
    "picture",
    "price",
    "sku"
  ],
  "attribute_as_label": "name",
  "attribute_as_image": "picture",
  "attribute_requirements": {
    "ecommerce": [
      "container_material",
      "description",
      "main_color",
      "name",
      "price",
      "sku"
    ],
    "mobile": [
      "description",
      "main_color",
      "name",
      "price",
      "sku"
    ],
    "print": [
      "description",
      "name",
      "price",
      "sku"
    ]
  },
  "labels": {
    "de_DE": "new family label DE",
    "en_US": "new family label US",
    "fr_FR": "new family label FR"
  }
}

request.description: Assuming that there is no "new_family" already existing
Assuming that the given codes are respectively the code of an existing family and an existing family variant
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing family
Assuming that the given codes are respectively the code of an existing family and an existing family variant
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing family
Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing locale

query.description: Get enabled locales
(integer , 1 by default ) • Number of the page to retrieve when using the `page` pagination method type
(integer , 10 by default ) • Number of results by page, see Pagination section
(boolean ) • Return the count of items in the response. Be carefull with that, on a big catalog, it can decrease performance in a significative way

request.description: Assuming that the given code is the code of an existing media file
Assuming that the given identifier is the identifier of an existing product and that the given attribute code exists

query.description: (boolean ) • Return labels of attribute options in the response. (Only available since the 5.0 version).
(boolean ) • Return product quality scores in the response. (Only available since the 5.0 version).
(boolean ) • Return product completenesses in the response. (Only available on SaaS platforms).

request.description: Assuming that the given identifier is the identifier of an existing product

query.description: Get products with only product values regarding the description and name attributes.
Get products with only product values regarding the en_US and fr_FR locales.
Get products from the tree linked to the ecommerce channel with only product values regarding the ecommerce channel (+ the product values of the non scopable attributes).
Get products that are purple, purple being an option of the simple select main_color attribute and this attribute being neither localizable nor scopable.
Get products having a description begining with Amazing on the en_US locale, the short_description attribute being localizable but not scopable.
Get products that have a release date due after the 4th of July 2016 for the ecommerce channel, the release_date attribute being scopable but not localizable.
Get products that have a name that contains with shirt on the en_US locale for the mobile channel, the name attribute being both localizable and scopable.
Get you the products with description starting with Amazing on the en_US locale for the ecommerce channel, and of purple color.
Get you the products with not empty description on the en_US locale and empty description on the fr_FR locale for the ecommerce channel.

If you need to filter on several attributes on the same locale, you can use the search_locale query parameter, to avoid repeating yourself for each attribute. This parameter expect an existing locale code.

If you need to filter on several attributes on the same scope, you can use the search_scope query parameter, to avoid repeating yourself for each attribute. This parameter expect an existing scope code.
Get the products of the winter_collection category.
Get the disabled products.
Get the products that are 100% complete for the ecommerce channel.
Get the products that are 100% complete on both the en_US and fr_FR locales for the ecommerce channel.
Get the products that are in the promotion group.
Get the products that are not in the camcorders and digital_cameras family.
Get the products that were created on the 4th of July 2016 at 10am.
Get the products that were updated during the last 4 days.
Get all the variant products of the apollon root product model without having to filter on all its sub-product models.
Get all the variant products of the sub product models with the codes tshirt_armor_blue and tshirt_armor_red.
Get all the variant products.
Get all the simple products.
Get the products with a "D" for the ecommerce channel and en_US locale.
Get the products with an "A" or "B" for the mobile channel and en_GB locale
(integer , 1 by default ) • Number of the page to retrieve when using the `page` pagination method type.
(boolean ) • Return the count of items in the response. Be carefull with that, on a big catalog, it can decrease performance in a significative way.
(string , page by default )  • Pagination method type.
(integer , 10 by default )  • Number of results by page.
(boolean ) • Return product quality scores in the response. (Only available since the 5.0 version).
(string , cursor to the first page by default ) • Cursor when using the `search_after` pagination method type. Should never be set manually.
(boolean ) • Return labels of attribute options in the response. (Only available since the 5.0 version).
(boolean ) • Return product completenesses in the response. (Only available on SaaS platforms).

query.description: Get published products with only published product values regarding the description and name attributes.
Get published products with only published product values regarding the en_US and fr_FR locales.

Get published products from the tree linked to the ecommerce channel with only published product values regarding the ecommerce channel (+ the published product values of the non scopable attributes).
Get published products that are purple
Get published products having a description begining with Amazing on the en_US locale
Get published products that have a release date due after the 4th of July 2016 for the ecommerce channel
Get published products that have a name that contains with shirt on the en_US locale for the mobile channel

Get the disabled published products.
Get the published products that are 100% complete for the ecommerce channel.
Get the published products that are 100% complete on both the en_US and fr_FR locales for the ecommerce channel.
Get the published products that are in the promotion group.
Get the published products that are not in the camcorders and digital_cameras family.
Get the published products that were created on the 4th of July 2016 at 10am.
Get the published products that were updated during the last 4 days.

If you need to filter on several attributes on the same locale, you can use the search_locale query parameter, to avoid repeating yourself for each attribute. This parameter expect an existing locale code.

If you need to filter on several attributes on the same channel, you can use the search_scope query parameter, to avoid repeating yourself for each attribute. This parameter expect an existing channel code.
